content.description: Climb up into the dihedral that is harder to get up that it looks.  Get up the left onto a giant ledge and take a rest.  Climb straight up over the crux, or (also challenging) traverse right to the corner, move up, and back left.  Finish up on easier ground.
content.protection: Double bolted anchor at the top.  You'll want to extend it farther than 2 double length slings will go, over the top, and ledge below the top.
content.location: Leftmost climb before the walkup.  When you hit the cliff from the approach trail, the climb will be directly in front of you.

content.description:
From the top of a grassy ledge, go up the easy slab to the right of the tree which is growing 1/3 of the way up the cliff. Step on the boulder which rocks slightly to bypass the overhang.

 If that boulder ever goes this will become much harder, but for now this is an easy way to get to the top.
content.protection: Adequate pro up to a tree anchor. Don't forget to pad the tree.
content.location: On the slabby face to the right of the dihedral, which is to the right of Don't Tease Me Bro.

content.description:
After a challenging start, proceed up the rest of a nice, easy climb to the top. 

  As an alternative, start as Mantle Peace, traverse around the corner, then continue up.
content.protection: Double bolted anchor at the top

content.description: These are the short faces approximately within sight of the concrete block atop the old ski hill.
